bibl.title: Testimony of Dr J. M. Morgan
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: I was called to see a man lying in the Hall of the house called the Bay windows lying upon his back in the North hall of the building there is two front door to the hall his head, part of the shouders underside the inner door he head a pillow under his head, the man had a wound upon the right side of his neck he was unconsious He breath was laboring there was no pusation of the radial artery by passing my hand on the region of the heart there was a very faint flutter scarcely perceptiable, I remained until he died and saw his body after death in my opinion the wound caused his death did not hear the shot dont know how long after when I arrived It was 8 minutes of one oclock when a man came to my office to go there, he died at one fifty five oclock
It was acrosss one block and one dead as fast as possible I think not our three Minutes after I was called before I got there

The man was lying as follows head rested on outside the inner door his body extending East reast with a pillow under his head saw then when I first went about 20 persons and do not know that I can name any particular one I paid particular attention
to the Wounded Man I might add by way of Correction that I said Ruby standing in the door leaning into the Middle Parlor,

Door in the outside of the hall was open when I arrived, Saw a Man 5 foot- 8to 10 In - heighth Would weigh aout 160 pounds rather broad shoulder hair Sndy X Cardose, quite heavy sandy Moustache some gray hair in it, balance face shaven smooth appeared to be fresh showered and or frontal any heavy the lower jaw, was aso heary, the whole face was heary and from the appearance of the Man I juded him to be rather a rough character at the time He had on a pair Cheap blue overals, a dark colored coat had a little ligth thread running through the Material flannel shirt had been laced up in front, was not when I first saw him his Boots were well worn one ripped in the eye seem and heels were worn of upon side as I remmeber them I dont think the Overalls were rolled up at the bottom he had no hat and I saw none in the Hall I passed a probe in the wound and found that the ball passed from the right side across and down and inwords beneath the Sternum
I can describe the position of the assailant and assailed the wound at the time he received the wound

The assailant was to the right and
in front it the ball ranged cross and downwards crossed and breaking I ha (illustratio to the court positiones)
I remaind wath the man died which was 1;55 O'Clock Am

As I stated before there was quite a crowd there I was working with the Man, My first efforts was to see if there was no external hemorage or from any vessels within reach, Next to restore the action of the heart failing in that the Man died there were several there most of them were stranges to me they brougth everything I asked for, I was furnished with brandy there the party was a stranger that broughth to me I do not know his nane, one man I do know his features but not his name
Subscribed and sworn to before me June 29 1886
